results.creator_credit: David Sproxton, Peter Lord, Colin Thomas and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animated Conversations”.
Based on a real life conversation, clay models are animated to act out the problems of a man attempting to get a meal from a welfare agency.

results.title: Architype
results.creator_credit: Henry Lutman, Colin Thomas and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animated Conversations”.
This brilliant short animation directed and animated by Henry Lutman uses a real conversation recording to portray two architects discussing a plan to build a new shopping mall. While the characters flick through large technical drafts of the mall a homeless man walks across the pages to reveal the social consequences of redevelopment and to show the viewer between the lines of the real conversation. The film outstandingly shows a multiplex of possible realities- the real conversation recording - the animated architects and a homeless man minimally draw into the stark architectural line drawings. The animated characters begin to seem more realistic than the real conversation recording the film is based on. This title is part of a series of animated films made by the BBC called Animated Conversations.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Henry Lutman, Colin Thomas and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: The Cat = A Macska
results.creator_credit: Tibor Hernadi and MAFILM Pannonia Filmstudio
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Animalia”.
The protagonists of the film are two mice who are engaged in complicated scientific debate and keep arguing until they are unceremoniously swallowed by a cat. All things are relative.

results.title: The Carp
results.creator_credit: Maxwell Munden and Max Munden Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Anglers’ Corner”.
One of a series of films on inland water fishing in England, introduced by Bernard Venables. Shows Leslie Brewer bottom fishing for carp in a Dorset lake early one summer morning. Gives facts about the fish, where it feeds and where to find it, tackle and bait used, and how to play the catch.

results.title: The Trout
results.creator_credit: Maxwell Munden and Max Munden Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Anglers’ Corner”
In a fast-flowing, rocky river in Yorkshire, we watch the angler casting into the areas where he suspects the trout is lying. These northern rivers of Britain produce a meaner, more hungry trout, who needs less tempting than the southern variety. Three flies are used in the wet fly technique, placed about a yard apart on the line. With the aid of an underwater camera we see the trout being played and caught.

results.title: The Trout
results.creator_credit: Maxwell Munden and Max Munden Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Anglers’ Corner”
Trout in the southern regions of Britain live in the gently flowing chalk rivers, finding plenty of food in the weeds and insects, so they must be tempted with the dry fly. We watch the angler waiting for the trout to rise after flies drifting downstream, then casting into a river in Berkshire. Underwater photography shows the fish - and the strike!

results.title: The Tench
results.creator_credit: Maxwell Munden and Max Munden Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Anglers’ Corner”
One of a series of films on inland water fishing in England introduced by Bernard Venables. On a soft late-summer day we go float fishing for tench on the Bridgewater Canal in Somerset. The behaviour of the fish and bait are seen in close up, a strike is shown and the fish is caught.
